journeyIntro.overview: Ghost of Yotei follows Atsu, a new protagonist in 1603 feudal Japan set around Mount Yotei in Ezo (modern-day Hokkaido). The game features new weapons (yari, kusarigama, odachi), a wolf companion, and a vast open world with 119 quests. Trophy hunters will find a familiar but expanded experience from Ghost of Tsushima.
journeyIntro.recommendedApproach: Play through the story on Casual difficulty while exploring naturally. Complete Sensei Tales early to unlock all weapon types. Use your wolf companion to find collectibles. After the story, use the map to systematically clear each region.
warnings: No missable trophies - everything available in post-game free roam
Can be completed on Casual difficulty with all accessibility features
Only need 30 of 61 Altars of Reflection for the trophy
Quests cannot be replayed except in New Game+
For platinum you need ~85% completion - not all collectibles required

trophies.name: Legendary Onryō
trophies.guide: Earn all other 53 trophies to unlock the platinum. Requires approximately 85% completion - not everything needs to be collected.
trophies.walkthrough: Focus on completing all bounties (31), camps (22), and the main collectibles. You only need 30 of 61 Altars. No missables means you can clean up anything after the story.

trophies.name: The Onryō Rests
trophies.description: Find a future beyond the hunt
trophies.guide: Story-related trophy. Unlocks automatically after completing the main story.

trophies.name: Master Bounty Hunter
trophies.guide: Complete all 31 bounty quests throughout Ezo. Bounties are combat-focused side missions.
trophies.walkthrough: Bounties unlock as you progress through the story and explore. They involve tracking and eliminating specific targets. Check the quest log for available bounties in each region.

trophies.name: Way of the Yari
trophies.description: Help defend Master Takahashi's dojo in the final battle
trophies.guide: Complete all 3 Sensei Tales for Takahashi's yari (spear) dojo, culminating in a defense battle.
trophies.walkthrough: The yari is a spear weapon new to the Ghost series. Find Takahashi's dojo and complete his questline to master the weapon and defend the dojo.

trophies.name: Way of the Kusarigama
trophies.description: Help defend Master Enomoto's dojo in the final battle
trophies.guide: Complete all 3 Sensei Tales for Enomoto's kusarigama (chain-sickle) dojo.
trophies.walkthrough: The kusarigama is a chain weapon with a sickle. Find Enomoto's dojo and complete his questline to unlock this versatile mid-range weapon.

trophies.name: Way of the Odachi
trophies.description: Help defend Master Yoshida's dojo in the final battle
trophies.guide: Complete all 3 Sensei Tales for Yoshida's odachi (great sword) dojo.
trophies.walkthrough: The odachi is a large two-handed sword with powerful sweeping attacks. Complete Yoshida's questline to master this heavy-hitting weapon.

trophies.name: For All Occasions
trophies.guide: Collect all 12 armor sets in the game.
trophies.walkthrough: Armor is obtained through story progression, Mythic Tales, side quests, and exploration. Some armor requires completing specific questlines.

trophies.name: Body, Mind, and Spirit
trophies.description: Complete all Bamboo Strikes, Shrine Climbs, and Hot Springs
trophies.guide: Find and complete all meditation/training activities across Ezo.
trophies.walkthrough: Similar to Ghost of Tsushima - Bamboo Strikes test reflexes, Shrine Climbs are platforming challenges, Hot Springs increase health. Use the map to track completion.

trophies.name: Moments of Reflection
trophies.guide: Discover and interact with 30 of the 61 Altars of Reflection scattered across Ezo.
trophies.walkthrough: Altars are small shrines in scenic locations. You only need 30 of 61, so you don't need to find them all. Your wolf companion can help locate nearby points of interest.

trophies.name: For the Living
trophies.description: Rid Ezo of all Yōtei Six Camps
trophies.guide: Liberate all 22 Yōtei Six enemy camps across Ezo.
trophies.walkthrough: Camps are enemy strongholds similar to Mongol camps in Tsushima. Clear all enemies and complete the objective to liberate each camp. They appear on the map as you explore.

trophies.name: The Snake
trophies.description: Complete the first tale of the Yōtei Six
trophies.guide: Story-related trophy. Unlocks after completing the first main tale targeting one of the Yōtei Six antagonists.

trophies.name: The Oni
trophies.description: Complete the second tale of the Yōtei Six
trophies.guide: Story-related trophy. Unlocks after completing the second main tale.

trophies.name: The Kitsune
trophies.description: Complete the third tale of the Yōtei Six
trophies.guide: Story-related trophy. Unlocks after completing the third main tale.

trophies.name: The Dragon
trophies.description: Complete the fourth tale of the Yōtei Six
trophies.guide: Story-related trophy. Unlocks after completing the fourth main tale.

trophies.name: The Spider
trophies.description: Complete the fifth tale of the Yōtei Six
trophies.guide: Story-related trophy. Unlocks after completing the fifth main tale.

trophies.name: The Woman Behind the Mask
trophies.description: Uncover the truth about the final member of the Yōtei Six
trophies.guide: Story-related trophy. Unlocks during the climax of the main story.

trophies.name: Twin Wolves
trophies.guide: Story-related trophy. Unlocks when Atsu fully bonds with her wolf companion.

trophies.name: Wrath of the Onryō
trophies.description: Embrace your destiny as the Onryō
trophies.guide: Story-related trophy. Unlocks during a pivotal story moment.

trophies.name: Trickster Fox
trophies.guide: Find and solve all 9 Puzzle Boxes hidden throughout Ezo.
trophies.walkthrough: Puzzle Boxes are small mechanical puzzles that reward cosmetics or resources. They're hidden in buildings and points of interest.

trophies.name: An Artist's Eye
trophies.guide: Find all 15 Sumi-e (ink wash) paintings scattered across Ezo.
trophies.walkthrough: Sumi-e paintings are collectible artworks found in scenic locations and buildings. They provide insight into the world's history.

trophies.name: Guardian of Inari
trophies.guide: Find all 11 Fox Dens across Ezo.
trophies.walkthrough: Fox Dens are small shrines where foxes lead you, similar to Inari Shrines in Tsushima. They reward charms and other bonuses.

trophies.name: Like Mother, Like Daughter
trophies.guide: Collect all 8 Shamisen Songs throughout Ezo.
trophies.walkthrough: Shamisen Songs are musical collectibles that Atsu can learn and play. Find musicians or song scrolls to expand your repertoire.

trophies.name: Wolves of Ezo
trophies.guide: Discover all 10 Wolf Dens in the wilderness.
trophies.walkthrough: Wolf Dens are locations where wild wolves gather. Your companion wolf can help you locate them. They may provide upgrades or lore.

trophies.name: Child of the Mountain
trophies.guide: Complete all 5 Mountain Reliquary puzzles.
trophies.walkthrough: Mountain Reliquaries are larger puzzle areas found on Mount Yotei and surrounding peaks. They involve environmental puzzles and platforming.

trophies.name: Speaking with the Land
trophies.guide: Find all 10 Special Places - unique scenic locations with significance.
trophies.walkthrough: Special Places are marked locations with particular beauty or historical importance. Visit and interact to appreciate the scenery and earn this trophy.

trophies.name: Tools of a Warrior
trophies.guide: Obtain all 5 melee weapon types: katana, yari, kusarigama, odachi, and one more.
trophies.walkthrough: Weapons unlock through story progression and completing Sensei Tales. Complete all dojo questlines to ensure you have every weapon.

trophies.name: Take Aim
trophies.guide: Obtain all 4 ranged weapon types including bows and potentially new additions.
trophies.walkthrough: Ranged weapons are found through story progression, quests, and exploration. Some may require completing specific side content.

trophies.name: Quick Draw
trophies.guide: Collect all 5 quickfire (throwable) weapon types like kunai, bombs, etc.
trophies.walkthrough: Similar to Ghost Weapons in Tsushima. Purchase or find all quickfire weapons through skill trees, quests, and merchants.

trophies.name: Inheritance
trophies.guide: Find and equip the special charms that belonged to Atsu's parents.
trophies.walkthrough: These story-related charms are likely obtained through main quests or specific side content related to Atsu's backstory.

trophies.name: Purely Decorative
trophies.guide: Collect 30 cosmetic items including armor dyes, headgear, masks, and weapon skins.
trophies.walkthrough: Vanity items are found in chests, purchased from merchants, and rewarded for completing activities. You'll naturally collect many while exploring.

trophies.name: From One Ghost to Another
trophies.guide: Execute a particular combat move, likely related to Ghost-style tactics.
trophies.walkthrough: This appears to reference stealth or assassination techniques. Master the ghost combat style through practice.

trophies.name: Sitturaynu
trophies.description: Work in harmony with your wolf companion
trophies.guide: Perform a coordinated attack or ability with your wolf companion.
trophies.walkthrough: The wolf companion is a major new feature. Learn to use companion commands and execute team attacks in combat.

trophies.name: A Moment to Breathe
trophies.description: Take a moment of calm during combat
trophies.guide: Use a specific calming or recovery ability during battle.
trophies.walkthrough: Likely involves using a Resolve-based healing or focus ability in the middle of combat.

trophies.name: Unrivaled
trophies.guide: Complete all one-on-one duels in the game.
trophies.walkthrough: Duels appear in story missions and side content. Focus on parrying and counterattacking. All duels can be retried if failed.

trophies.name: Kunai Defender
trophies.guide: Deflect a certain number of enemy projectiles using parry timing.
trophies.walkthrough: When enemies throw projectiles, time your parry (L1) perfectly to deflect them. Practice against archers and bomb throwers.

trophies.name: Gift for Destruction
trophies.guide: Use explosives or fire to destroy a certain number of environmental objects or enemies.
trophies.walkthrough: Use sticky bombs, fire arrows, or other explosive tools on destructible objects and enemy groups.

trophies.name: Naming a Friend
trophies.description: Give your wolf companion a name
trophies.guide: Progress the story or complete a quest that allows you to officially name your wolf.
trophies.walkthrough: This likely unlocks through story progression as your bond with the wolf deepens.

trophies.name: From the Hip
trophies.description: Perform quick-draw kills in rapid succession
trophies.guide: Kill multiple enemies quickly using standoff or quick-draw techniques.
trophies.walkthrough: Enter a standoff and chain multiple kills, or use a similar rapid-kill mechanic new to Yotei.

trophies.name: The Owl's Talon
trophies.guide: Perform a certain number of aerial attacks or kills.
trophies.walkthrough: Jump and attack enemies from above. Look for elevated positions in combat areas for aerial opportunities.

trophies.name: Sayonara
trophies.description: Defeat enemies with a dramatic finishing move
trophies.guide: Perform execution or finishing moves on a number of enemies.
trophies.walkthrough: When enemies are staggered or low health, you may get a prompt for a cinematic kill. Execute these finishers.

trophies.name: You Dropped This
trophies.guide: Pick up and use dropped enemy weapons to kill enemies.
trophies.walkthrough: When enemies drop their weapons, pick them up and use them in combat. Throw spears or use fallen enemy swords.

trophies.name: The Horror
trophies.guide: Cause enemies to flee in terror using fear-inducing techniques.
trophies.walkthrough: Use Ghost Stance equivalent, poison, or brutal kills to terrify nearby enemies and make them flee.

trophies.name: Wolf Bait
trophies.description: Use your wolf to distract enemies
trophies.guide: Command your wolf to distract enemies while you attack.
trophies.walkthrough: Use wolf companion commands to draw enemy attention, then attack from stealth or flank them.

trophies.name: Two as One
trophies.description: Perform a synchronized attack with your wolf
trophies.guide: Execute a coordinated double attack with your wolf companion.
trophies.walkthrough: Build up your bond with the wolf to unlock synchronized attack abilities. Trigger them in combat for devastating combo attacks.

trophies.name: Brush Fire
trophies.guide: Set multiple enemies or areas on fire using fire-based weapons or abilities.
trophies.walkthrough: Use fire arrows, fire bombs, or environmental fire to burn enemies. Look for oil puddles and dry grass.

trophies.name: Sake Flight
trophies.guide: Drink sake at different sake houses or breweries across Ezo.
trophies.walkthrough: Find sake establishments in towns and villages. Interact to drink and learn about local brewing traditions.

trophies.name: Very Persuasive
trophies.guide: Successfully use dialogue options to resolve situations peacefully or gain advantages.
trophies.walkthrough: Choose dialogue carefully in conversations. Some situations allow you to talk your way through rather than fight.

trophies.name: Charming
trophies.description: Equip charms in all available slots
trophies.guide: Fill all your charm slots with equipped charms.
trophies.walkthrough: Unlock charm slots through progression and find charms via Fox Dens, shrines, and quests. Equip a charm in every slot.

trophies.name: Like Father, Like Daughter
trophies.guide: Complete a specific activity or quest related to Atsu's father.
trophies.walkthrough: This likely involves visiting a memorial, completing a family-related quest, or using your father's equipment.

trophies.name: Gifts for a Ghost
trophies.guide: Receive a certain number of gifts from NPCs you've helped.
trophies.walkthrough: Help villagers and complete side quests. Grateful NPCs will reward you with gifts. Collect enough to unlock the trophy.

trophies.name: Memento
trophies.guide: Collect or keep a specific memento item from the story.
trophies.walkthrough: Pay attention to story moments where you can keep meaningful items. This is likely story-related.

trophies.name: Good with Coins
trophies.guide: Accumulate a certain amount of currency through selling items or completing jobs.
trophies.walkthrough: Sell unwanted items to merchants, complete bounties, and save your money. The threshold is likely reasonable through normal play.

trophies.name: Fireside Performance
trophies.guide: Play your shamisen at a campfire location.
trophies.walkthrough: Find a campfire and interact to rest. You should have an option to play the shamisen, similar to the flute in Tsushima.

trophies.name: Spear Fishing
trophies.guide: Use your yari (spear) to catch 5 fish from rivers or the ocean.
trophies.walkthrough: Find bodies of water with fish. Equip the yari and attack fish swimming in the water. You need to successfully spear 5 fish total.

suggestedOrder.description: Complete introductory story missions and start Sensei Tales to unlock all weapon types. Bond with your wolf companion.
Progress through the main Yōtei Six storyline. Complete dojo questlines and start bounty hunting.
Complete the main story and remaining Mythic Tales. Clear all enemy camps.
Finish all 31 bounty quests across Ezo.
Use your wolf and the map to find remaining collectibles. Only need 30 of 61 Altars.
Complete all Bamboo Strikes, Shrine Climbs, Hot Springs, and gather remaining armor.
Finish remaining combat-related trophies and miscellaneous activities.
With ~85% completion, the platinum is yours!
